remarks: A set containing the zero element of a module is always linearly dependent, if the underlying ring has at least two elements. (Contributed by AV, 13-Apr-2019.)  (Revised by AV, 27-Apr-2019.)  (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Jul-2019.)
statement: el0ldep $p |- ( ( ( M e. LMod /\ 1 < ( # ` ( Base ` ( Scalar ` M ) ) ) ) /\ S e. ~P ( Base ` M ) /\ ( 0g ` M ) e. S ) -> S linDepS M ) $.
